summary: The Alhambra is a stunning palace and fortress in Granada, Spain, known for its Islamic architecture. It was built in the 13th century by Muhammad I and was the last Muslim state in Spain. The complex includes beautiful palaces, gardens, and a fortress. Over time, it was modified by different rulers, with significant changes in the 14th century. After the Christian Reconquista, it became a royal court and was later restored and turned into a tourist attraction. The Alhambra's unique design, with courtyards and intricate decorations, makes it a famous UNESCO World Heritage Site.
title: Alhambra
